        },
        closeMenu: function() {
          $(this.trigger).removeClass(this.activeClass);

          var self = this;

            /* Get Top Most Parent and the siblings */
            var top_siblings = sub_menu.parents('.responsive-menu-item-has-children').last().siblings('.responsive-menu-item-has-children');
            var first_siblings = sub_menu.parents('.responsive-menu-item-has-children').first().siblings('.responsive-menu-item-has-children');
            /* Close up just the top level parents to key the rest as it was */
            top_siblings.children('.responsive-menu-submenu').slideUp(200, 'linear').removeClass('responsive-menu-submenu-open');
            /* Set each parent arrow to inactive */
            top_siblings.each(function() {
              $(this).find('.responsive-menu-subarrow').first().html(self.inactiveArrow);
              $(this).find('.responsive-menu-subarrow').first().removeClass('responsive-menu-subarrow-active');
            });
            /* Now Repeat for the current item siblings */
            first_siblings.children('.responsive-menu-submenu').slideUp(200, 'linear').removeClass('responsive-menu-submenu-open');
            first_siblings.each(function() {
              $(this).find('.responsive-menu-subarrow').first().html(self.inactiveArrow);
              $(this).find('.responsive-menu-subarrow').first().removeClass('responsive-menu-subarrow-active');
            });
          }
          if(sub_menu.hasClass('responsive-menu-submenu-open')) {

            case 'left':

            case 'right':
              translate = 'translateX(-' + this.menuWidth() + 'px)'; break;
            case 'top':
              translate = 'translateY(' + this.wrapperHeight() + 'px)'; break;
            case 'bottom':
              translate = 'translateY(-' + this.menuHeight() + 'px)'; break;

              self.triggerSubArrow($(this).children('.responsive-menu-subarrow').first());
            });
          }

      };

	<div class="container center mb60">
    
    	<h6>What our clients say...</h6>

            <div id="carousel-testimonials" class="carousel slide" data-ride="carousel">
  <!-- Indicators -->
  <ol class="carousel-indicators">
    <li data-target="#carousel-testimonials" data-slide-to="0" class="active"></li>
    <li data-target="#carousel-testimonials" data-slide-to="1"></li>
    <li data-target="#carousel-testimonials" data-slide-to="2"></li>
    <li data-target="#carousel-testimonials" data-slide-to="3"></li>
    <li data-target="#carousel-testimonials" data-slide-to="4"></li>
  </ol>

  <!-- Wrapper for slides -->
  <div class="carousel-inner" role="listbox">
  		 

    <div class="item">
     <div class="col-lg-12 hp-testimonials ">
            
            	<p>Goodform provide a brilliant service which makes them feel very much like an extension of our team rather than an agency.  Their insight and knowledge of CRM marketing is a given but it's the personal touch and the willingness to go above and beyond which makes them a must-have for an organisation who is serious about their data.</p>
                
                <p class="testimonial-author">Marketing Manager, Rugby World Cup 2015</p>
            
            </div>
    </div>	
    
	 

    <div class="item">
     <div class="col-lg-12 hp-testimonials ">
            
            	<p>Their supportive and innovative account team have helped deliver excellent results, greatly increasing the size and engagement of our database.</p>
                
                <p class="testimonial-author">Digital Communications Manager, RBS 6 Nations</p>
            
            </div>
    </div>	
    
	 

    <div class="item">
     <div class="col-lg-12 hp-testimonials ">
            
            	<p>Goodform not only provide excellent administration, customer service and operational support for England Rugby Supporters Club, but are also embedded within the strategic direction of the scheme. Goodform understand the sport of rugby and most importantly our members and through their knowledge they help us to harness the passion, loyalty and pride of England rugby fans.</p>
                
                <p class="testimonial-author">Head of Marketing, Rugby Football Union</p>
            
            </div>
    </div>	
    
	 

    <div class="item">
     <div class="col-lg-12 hp-testimonials ">
            
            	<p>Goodform consistently provide us with meaningful metrics for us to engage with our sponsors and to also improve event satisfaction going forward. The visual chartered reporting style allows data to be easily interpreted at all levels of our organisation.</p>
                
                <p class="testimonial-author">General Manager – Commercial, British Athletics</p>
            
            </div>
    </div>	
    
	 

    <div class="item">
     <div class="col-lg-12 hp-testimonials ">
            
            	<p>The Goodform team excel at producing creative and effective email designs. Through their continual analysis of our database they have built up an understanding of our customers and target audience, which leads to the design and broadcast of personalised, meaningful and optimised campaigns with an impressive ROI.</p>
                
                <p class="testimonial-author">Commercial Director, Hampshire Cricket, The Ageas Bowl</p>
            
            </div>
    </div>	
    
		

  </div>

Home

Welcome to the website of the Forth Yacht Clubs Association.

Latest News

  • Canal Carnival to celebrate re-opening of Forth & Clyde Canal (6 February, 2019) - The historic Forth & Clyde Canal will spring to life this May as a floating festival to celebrate its re-opening to coast-to-coast boat traffic takes to the water. Organised by canal custodians Scottish Canals in conjunction with various canal-focused voluntary bodies, the Lowland Canal Carnival will see a flotilla of steam boats, yachts, narrowboats, rowing […]
  • RFYC Boat Jumble (3 February, 2019) - At Royal Forth Yacht Club
  • Forth Series 2019 (28 January, 2019) - Join in the Forth Series for 2019.
  • Tide Tables for 2019 (26 January, 2019) - Please note the tide tables have been removed from the sidebar and can now be found on the Tides and Weather page/link. Click here to go there.
  • Lowland Canals Update (30 November, 2018) - Dear boater, I wanted to share with you some fantastic news that was announced last week by the Scottish Government; we are getting an additional £5.35 million of funding to invest in improvements and upgrades to assets across the network. This will include the replacement of four pairs of lock gates on the Forth & […]
  • Landing Pontoon at Stirling Old Town Harbour to Open (6 November, 2018) - Stirling City has just completed the installation of a landing pontoon at the Old Town Harbour, just downstream of the footbridge to Cambuskenneth Abbey, not far from the rail station. The opening ceremony is due on 18th November at 12.00 noon and all boaters ashore or afloat will be most welcome. Overhead clearance under the […]
  • Scottish Canals Update (6 November, 2018) - Kathy Gostick and Andy Carnduff have been adding to the pressure on Scottish Canals to move a bit closer to their statutory obligations and make all of the Scottish canals fit and safe for recreational boating. We are members of the Keep the Canals Alive! group of active users and we seem to be having […]
  • Stirling Town Quay and Cramond Heritage Trail (29 October, 2018) - A couple of updates for FYCA members from Paul Shave. 1. The pontoon and landing walkway has been installed at Stirling Town Quay. Access to and from the walkway is by a gate with a key pad. I don’t know who controls it. I suspect that the Council is still sorting that out. 2. This […]
  • PEYC Regatta 23rd September 2018 (21 September, 2018) - Calling all skippers – If you are intending to sail in the PEYC Yacht Regatta this Sunday can you please submit an entry form on the club website. Entry Form The first prize in each division is dinner for two at the new Scott’s restaurant at the marina. Many thanks.
  • Forth & Clyde Canal Closed for Whole 2018 Year. (16 September, 2018) - Richard Millar of Scottish Canals announced on Monday 29th January that the F&C canal will be unavailable for Sea to Sea transit during this whole year due to major engineering failures with the Bonnybridge and the Twechar opening road bridges and insufficient funds available to carry out full operability repairs! The Caledonian and Crinan canals […]
  • Port Edgar Yacht Club Annual Yacht Regatta 23rd September (9 September, 2018) - Port Edgar Yacht Club invites all yachts to join in their annual yacht regatta on the 23rd September. Racing for divisions 1, 2 & 3 will take place in St Davids Bay commencing at 1030. Briefing will be on the radio so visiting yachts can go straight to the race area. Those not wishing to […]
  • Forth Series 2018 Preliminary Results (6 September, 2018) - With one event to go for  Division 1 the Forth Series 2018 is nearly over. There are results available on the Forth Series 2018 page. The tables will be tidied up in due course. Any errors please email info@fyca.org.uk  
  • PEYC Annual Yacht Regatta (27 August, 2018) - The NOR for the PEYC Annual Yacht Regatta has been released and can be found here or on the Forth Series 2018 page.  
  • DBSC Gavin Adamson Trophy (24 August, 2018) - The SIs are now available for the race on 26th August. 2018 Gavin Adamson SIs
  • FCYC Bell Rock Trophy SI’s Available (16 August, 2018) - The Bell Rock Trophy SI is available for download here – Bell Rock SI – FINAL 2018. Please note that the Beer Festival tickets are sold out.
  • Burntisland Regatta (8 August, 2018) - The members and management committee of Burntisland Sailing Club would like to wish you a warm welcome to its 64th annual Regatta being held this weekend. The Sailing Instructions can be downloaded here.
  • Stirling Town Quay (7 August, 2018) - Please see Page 17 of the Times, Wednesday 1 August 2018, “River port plan could see millions flow in”. Work has begun on a 35m pontoon for completion by the end of September. It is intended for trip boats but presumably will be available to leisure craft at other times. Besides the tidal rise and […]
  • Gavin Adamson NOR Published (23 July, 2018) - The Gavin Adamson NOR can be downloaded here 2018 GavinAdamsonNoR.
  • Oban Bay Consultation (9 July, 2018) - Colleagues RYA Scotland has been engaged in discussions around the development of a revised harbour authority in Oban Bay. The attached information gives more detail on the current position and comes with a request that you share this information as widely as possible.  It is written to suit a post on social media but will […]
  • Aberdour Boat Regatta (9 July, 2018) - The Sis are now available on the Division 2 Forth Series page.
